name: Akavan Erityisalat
goal:
Akava Special Branches is a multidisciplinary Union with 22 independent member organisations, operating in Finland. Our members have a diploma in higher education and work in expert and managerial positions in the fields of culture, administration, communications and wellbeing.

The main task of Akava Special Branches and its member organisations is to ensure a good working life and fair salaries for their members. Akava Special Branches provide its members with advice and help with employment contracts, salaries, career development and other work-related matters. We take care of developing the working life and unemployment benefits in general. We take care of our members’ best interests in the labour market; for example, in contract negotiations. We are also involved in the sustainable development of working life and aim to increase the respect of the fields we represent.

Akava Special Branches is a member organisation of the central labour organisation Akava in Finland (www.akava.fi).
interests: Competition, Culture, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, International co-operation and development
euInitiatives: EU initiatives concerning e.g. employment policy-, social justice and social policy-, taxation policy- and education policy issues.
